data.title: Kalmar's Q3 2025 report shows record-high operating profit margin of 13.8%, with orders received at EUR 375 million, down 10%. Sales increased 3% to EUR 436 million, while profit for the period was EUR 45 million. Cash flow from operations was EUR 26 million. Orders for the period totaled EUR 1,306 million, an increase of 9%, with an order book of EUR 961 million. Operating profit in the period was EUR 160 million. Kalmar expects a comparable operating profit margin above 12% in 2025. The company emphasizes sustainability and innovation in its strategy for growth. Kalmar's vision includes targets for sales growth, comparable operating profit margin, ROCE, leverage, dividend payout ratio, and a commitment to the SBTi targets. The full article is available on Benzinga.com.
data.description: Kalmar Corporation released its interim report for January-September 2025, on October 31, 2025. The report highlights an improved profitability with a record-high comparable operating profit margin of 13.8%. Equipment orders received declined by 20% compared to the previous period, but year-to-date showed solid growth. In July-September 2025, orders received totaled EUR 375 million, down by 10%, while the order book stood at EUR 961 million. Sales increased by 3% to EUR 436 million. Operating profit was EUR 61 million, representing 13.9% of sales. Cash flow from operations was EUR 26 million. Profit for the period amounted to EUR 45 million. For January-September 2025, orders received increased by 9%, reaching EUR 1,306 million. Sales decreased by 2% to EUR 1,254 million. Operating profit was EUR 160 million, representing 12.8% of sales. Cash flow from operations was EUR 133 million, and profit for the period was EUR 118 million. The company expects its comparable operating profit margin to be above 12% for the year. Kalmar achieved various sustainability milestones and financial targets for 2028 include sales growth of 5% per annum, a 15% comparable operating profit margin, and a dividend payout ratio of 30-50% annually, among others. Kalmar is committed to sustainable innovations and operational excellence to drive profitability and growth.

data.title: Stock futures up heading into Friday: Exxon Mobil expected to report $1.82/share earnings on $87.71 billion revenue, Apple beats Q4 earnings with $102.47 billion revenue.
data.description: US stock futures are up today, with investors focusing on certain stocks. Exxon Mobil Corp. (NYSE: XOM) is expected to report earnings of $1.82 per share on revenue of $87.71 billion. The company's shares fell 0.3% to $114.30 in after-hours trading. Apple Inc. (NASDAQ: AAPL) posted strong financial results for Q4 of fiscal 2025, surpassing expectations. The tech giant reported revenue of $102.47 billion for the quarter, outperforming analyst forecasts. For more details, visit a financial news website.

data.title: Exxon Mobil anticipates Q3 earnings at $1.82/share, revenue at $87.71B, down from $90.02B last year; stock closes at $114.69.
data.description: On Friday, October 31, Exxon Mobil Corporation (NYSE: XOM) will report its third-quarter earnings before the market opens. Analysts predict earnings of $1.82 per share, a decrease from $1.92 per share in the same period last year. Revenue for the quarter is estimated at $87.71 billion, lower than the $90.02 billion reported a year ago. The company, based in Spring, Texas, saw its stock close at $114.69 on Thursday, dropping by 1.5%. Exxon Mobil's recent stock performance was bolstered by a rally in the sector following U.S. sanctions on Russian oil producers, leading to an increase in crude prices, ultimately benefiting the company's profitability. For further details and analyst ratings, readers can refer to the Analyst Stock Ratings page on Benzinga.

data.title: ECB sets 2.55% P2R capital requirement for AB Artea bankas, effective from 1 Jan 2026, 0.01 p.p. less than previous.
data.description: After conducting the Supervisory Review and Evaluation Process (SREP) of AB Artea bankas, the European Central Bank (ECB) has imposed a new additional capital requirement (P2R) of 2.55%. This figure, calculated under Pillar II, will be applicable from 1 January 2026. It represents a slight decrease of 0.01 percentage points compared to the previous assessment in the SREP.

data.title: Sidetrade and NX Partners team up to boost CFO resilience in Benelux and Switzerland with AI solutions, financial expertise.
data.description: Sidetrade, a prominent company specializing in AI-driven Order-to-Cash tools, has revealed a new collaboration with NX Partners, a renowned financial advisory firm catering to top enterprises in Western Europe. Through this partnership, Sidetrade's advanced AI technology and data proficiency will be merged with NX Partners' financial knowledge to empower CFOs with the flexibility, oversight, and assurance needed to navigate swiftly changing market landscapes. This strategic alliance aims to provide CFOs with the tools and support necessary to adapt and thrive amidst dynamic market environments.
